intro: Dichaetanthera lutescens, commonly known as the yellow tasselbush, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dichaetanthera lutescens is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides.
